thread.title: Nicole Kidman says she's passed on acting gigs to be a mum | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Nicole Kidman says she's passed on acting gigs to be a mum | Daily Mail Online

author: Benge Nsenduluka For Daily Mail Australia
title: Nicole Kidman says she's passed on acting gigs to be a mum | Daily Mail Online
text: Share 106 shares '... I'm raising a six and an eight-year-old who are in school so there's only a certain amount of time I can work because of their school year. She added: 'That means I pass on things a lot ... because ultimately (and this is just me) my family life is the most important thing to me so I'm not going to jeopardize that in any way shape or form.' 'Keith and I always say that we are just so lucky to have each other': Nicole recently opened up about her marriage to husband Keith Urban She shares adopted children Isabella Jane, 24, and Connor Anthony, 22, with ex-husband Tom Cruise. Nicole is set to return to the small screen in the forthcoming comedy-drama miniseries Big Little Lies. The show stars Reese Witherspoon and Laura Dern and is based on author Liane Moriarty's book of the same name. Last week, Nicole, who is married to singer Keith Urban, 46, revealed the secret to her happy marriage ahead of their 11th wedding anniversary. 'Through absolute commitment and kindness, the desire to protect and help each other': The 41-year-old revealed how she and Keith have stayed together for so long She told news.com.au that for them, marriage is about 'absolute commitment and kindness, the desire to protect and help each other.' She added: 'Thatâ€™s what our relationship is.' The Lion star couldn't stop herself when it came to gushing over her devoted husband. 'In this world, to be able to come back to that love and that strength is so nourishing and powerful,' the Lion star gushed 'Keith and I always say that we are just so lucky to have each other,' Nicole continued. 'In this world, to be able to come back to that love and that strength is so nourishing and powerful.' Despite their loved-up displays, rumours have been rife that their marriage is on the rocks. 'People make up the most insane crap, and we kind of just roll with it': Keith has been forced to defend his marriage against baseless rumours Keith recently told the Today show's Richard Wilkins that it's difficult to keep on top of the rumours as the couple enjoyed their lives out of the spotlight, moving between NSW's Southern Highlands and their home in Nashville, Tennessee. He said: 'People make up the most insane crap, and we kind of just roll with it. 'It does [annoy me], I want to live our life together, and the fact we live somewhere where we're not being photographed all the time - it makes it possible for people to make up that stuff because you're not always there to defend it.' Keith and Nicole tied the knot in June 2006 during a secret Sydney wedding, before welcoming daughters Sunday Rose in 2008 and Faith Margaret in 2011.
